members.name: Dr. Sarah Mitchell
members.bio: Dr. Mitchell is the founder and director of RAIN Lab at Lebanese American University. Her research focuses on natural language understanding, neural reasoning, and large language models. She has published over 50 papers in top-tier AI conferences and journals.

members.name: Dr. Omar Hassan
members.bio: Omar's research focuses on commonsense reasoning and knowledge-grounded dialogue systems. He completed his PhD at MIT and joined RAIN Lab in 2023. His work has been published at NeurIPS, ICML, and ACL.

members.name: Alice Johnson
members.bio: Alice's research focuses on multi-hop reasoning and question answering systems. She is particularly interested in developing models that can perform complex logical inference across multiple documents and knowledge sources.

members.name: Bob Chen
members.bio: Bob works on large language models and their ability to perform commonsense reasoning. His research explores how to incorporate external knowledge into neural models for better reasoning capabilities and factual accuracy.

members.name: Carol Martinez
members.bio: Carol's research interests lie in explainable AI and interpretable neural models for NLP. She develops methods to make language models more transparent and trustworthy, with applications in question answering and text generation.

members.name: Rami Khalil
members.bio: Rami recently joined RAIN Lab and is working on neural text generation and controllable generation. His research aims to develop methods for generating more diverse, coherent, and controllable text outputs from language models.

members.name: Lina Abboud
members.bio: Lina's research focuses on multilingual NLP and cross-lingual transfer learning, with a special focus on Arabic language processing. She develops models that can effectively transfer knowledge across languages with limited resources.

members.name: David Kim
members.bio: David is working on dialogue systems and conversational AI for his master's thesis. His current project focuses on building more engaging and context-aware chatbots that can maintain coherent long-form conversations.

members.name: Emma Wilson
members.bio: Emma's research explores neural text summarization and information extraction from scientific documents. She is developing tools to help researchers quickly understand and navigate large volumes of academic literature.

members.name: Nour Mansour
members.bio: Nour is working on sentiment analysis and opinion mining from social media data. Her research aims to better understand public opinion and emotion expressed in online discussions, particularly in Arabic social media.

members.name: Frank Zhang
members.bio: Frank is an undergraduate researcher working on named entity recognition and information extraction. He is helping develop tools to automatically extract structured information from unstructured text documents.

members.name: Maya Khoury
members.bio: Maya is an undergraduate student working on text classification and document categorization. She assists with data collection, annotation, and evaluation of NLP models for various classification tasks.

members.name: Prof. James Anderson
members.bio: Prof. Anderson is a visiting scholar from Stanford University, collaborating with RAIN Lab on neural reasoning and symbolic AI integration. He is spending a sabbatical year exploring new approaches to hybrid AI systems.

members.name: Dr. Yuki Tanaka
members.bio: Dr. Tanaka is a visiting researcher from the University of Tokyo, working on cross-lingual information retrieval and multilingual question answering. Her visit is funded by a JSPS fellowship for overseas research.
